resumo: "John Jagon henki tahi kuollutko vai el채v채?" by Wilkie Collins is a novel written in the late 19th century. The story revolves around a young English lawyer named Filip Lefrank, who, after being instructed by his doctor to rest, travels to America to visit relatives. There, he encounters a tangled web of family dynamics, including the presence of a captivating young woman named Naomi and a mysterious figure named John Jago, hinting at deeper conflicts and tensions that may unfold. He decides to visit his relatives in America, where misgivings arise surrounding family members, particularly the enigmatic peasant John Jago, who seems to hold a significant influence over the household.
